critique: This document establishes a board to investigate a dispute between Pan American World Airways and its employees. It aims to prevent interruption of interstate commerce. There's no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration stance, executive power grab, federalism implications, or national security concerns. It seems to be a fairly neutral intervention to resolve a labor dispute. The economic regulation aspect is moderate, as it temporarily freezes the conditions of the dispute. There's no direct impact on social inclusion.
